page.title: 08SHOPPING
page.content: There is{one shop}(and post office) in the middle of the island. It sells {food}and newspapers,cigarettes and {Welly boots}_almost everything. It is {not licensed.}The shopkeeper has to pay MacBrayne{freight}for everything that comes to his shop. Much{shopping}is done in{Oban.}Food is bought in a supermarket, packed into boxes, delivered to the boat and carried with the passenger to Lismore. Some{mutton, beef and pork,}is bought on the hoof,{butchered}on the island and packed into deep freezes.Some{fish is caught _{shellfish and cuddies. Some shopping , mainly for{clothes, is done by{Mail Order.}A couple of {vans}come round with clothes and carpets. A Sale Day in Perth or Stirling gives time for a visit to Marks and Spencer, and there are other outings to Glasgow and Edinburgh.
